results.adx_keywords: Rap and Hip-Hop;Decisions and Verdicts;Assaults;Megan Thee Stallion (Rapper);Tory Lanez (Rapper);Los Angeles (Calif)
results.byline: By Blanca Begert, Joe Coscarelli and Douglas Morino
results.title: Tory Lanez Found Guilty of Shooting Megan Thee Stallion
results.abstract: Mr. Lanez, a Canadian rapper, fired at the Houston hip-hop star after an argument in 2020. The matter became the subject of speculation and gossip on social media and in songs.

media.caption: Tory Lanez is driven away from a Los Angeles courthouse earlier this month. On Friday, he was convicted of three felony counts in the shooting of a fellow artist, Megan Thee Stallion.

results.adx_keywords: News and News Media;Snow and Snowstorms;Social Media;Waterloo (Iowa)
results.title: An Iowa Sports Reporter Was Sent to Cover the Weather. He Did Not Like It.
results.abstract: After sporting events were canceled in Iowa, Mark Woodley was pressed into service covering the storm. “I didn’t realize that there was a 3:30 also in the morning until today,” he said.

media.caption: Mark Woodley, a sports anchor and reporter for KWWL in Iowa, reporting live, if grudgingly, from Waterloo very early on Friday morning.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Computers and the Internet;Musk, Elon;Twitter
results.title: She Worked for Twitter. Then She Tweeted at Elon Musk.
results.abstract: Sasha Solomon, a software engineer, joined others in the media business who lost their jobs this year after publicly taking on their employers.

media.caption: Sasha Solomon, formerly of Twitter, at her home in Portland, Ore.
media.copyright: Ricardo Nagaoka for The New York Times

results.abstract: Want to transfer money from a 529 plan to a Roth I.R.A. or get an after-tax employee match in your Roth 401(k)? You may be in luck.

results.title: Arizona Judge Rejects Kari Lake’s Effort to Overturn Her Election Loss
results.abstract: Kari Lake, a Republican who was defeated by Katie Hobbs in the Arizona governor’s race, had made false election claims the centerpiece of her campaign.

results.title: A Very Streaming Christmas
results.abstract: With so many Christmas movies to stream this season, which ones are quality nuggets and which are lumps of coal?

results.adx_keywords: internal-sub-only;Abortion;Plan B (Contraceptive);Abortion Drugs;Labeling and Labels (Product);Food and Drug Administration;Foundation Consumer Healthcare (Kelso & Co LP)
results.title: The F.D.A. Now Says It Plainly: Morning-After Pills Are Not Abortion Pills
results.abstract: Labels of Plan B One-Step had previously said, without scientific evidence, that the pill might block fertilized eggs from implanting in the womb.

media.caption: A common morning-after pill, approved in 1999 and now sold as Plan B One-Step, does not block a fertilized egg’s ability to implant in the uterus — a claim that abortion opponents have used to erroneously call it an abortion pill.

results.title: ‘Everyone Wants to Hear’ This One Chord in a Christmas Carol
results.abstract: A moment in “O Come, All Ye Faithful” is so popular, it’s printed on T-shirts. But it’s also symbolic, and important to music history.

media.caption: Choristers at King’s College, Cambridge, where David Willcocks, who arranged a version of “O Come, All Ye Faithful” featuring a now-famous chord, was the director of music.

results.title: Kentucky Lawmaker Speaks Out About Transgender Son’s Suicide
results.abstract: Henry Berg-Brousseau, who had supported transgender rights since he was in high school, died by suicide at 24. “This hate building across the country weighed on him,” his mother said.

media.caption: Henry Berg-Brousseau at a gala for the Human Rights Campaign, where he was the deputy press secretary for politics.

results.abstract: The Netflix hit has been widely mocked from the beginning. But despite its flaws — or perhaps because of them — it’s a pop-culture phenomenon.
